title: Prime Ministers of Canada | Historica Canada Education Portal
snippet: We welcome feedback regarding the content that may be linked to or included in these learning tools; email us at education@HistoricaCanada.ca. The student will identify Canada’s Prime Ministers since Confederation and place the Prime Ministers along a time line.

title: Prime Minister of Canada Justin Trudeau | UN Office for Partnerships
snippet: This background helped spark his passion for public service and shaped his conviction that diversity is Canada’s strength. Justin studied literature at McGill University, graduating with a Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) in 1994.

title: Canadian PMs’ Higher Education Experiences | HESA
snippet: Eighteen: The number of Prime Ministers with university degrees. Of the five who did not have one, three were the aforementioned lawyers. The other two were Alexander Mackenzie, who apprenticed in Stonemasonry, and Mackenzie Bowell who had a teaching diploma (not a higher education credential back then) from a long-defunct Normal School in Hastings, Ontario.
